forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: Isolated snow showers. Mostly sunny. High near 31, with temperatures falling to around 22 in the afternoon. West northwest wind around 25 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%. New snow accumulation of less than one inch possible.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.shortForecast: Scattered Snow Showers then Partly Cloudy
forecast.detailedForecast: Scattered snow showers before 11pm. Partly cloudy, with a low around 5. Wind chill values as low as -13. West northwest wind 15 to 25 mph, with gusts as high as 40 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

weather_report:
The current conditions in Evanston reveal a brisk and cold atmosphere, with temperatures hovering in the mid-20s and a mostly cloudy sky casting a muted light over Lake Michigan. Despite the chill, the air remains fresh and invigorating, ideal for a quick walk along the beach—though one should expect the feeling of the temperature to drop significantly as the wind picks up in the afternoon, promising gusty conditions that could sweep across the shoreline.

Looking ahead, isolated snow showers are forecasted for the afternoon, transitioning to scattered snow flurries as night falls. Temperatures will gradually decline, dipping into the single digits while wind chills could plummet to a biting -13 degrees. The chance of any significant snowfall remains low, with only minor accumulations expected. As the evening approaches, the scene may grow more wintry, emphasizing a stark contrast to the day’s slightly sunlit hours. For those planning outdoor activities, dressing in layers, including a warm coat, gloves, and a hat will be essential to ward off the cold. Given the seasonal character of December in the Midwest, these temperatures are typical of winter, heralding the arrival of more frigid days ahead. Enjoying a warm beverage indoors may be a more inviting option this evening, though a late stroll along the beach could provide a solitary moment of reflection as the snow begins to dance in the frigid air.
